definition: (Tw) to guide sb in the right direction/to correct (behavior etc)
to transmit/to lead/to guide/to conduct/to direct
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive

sentences.english: The publisher did not reveal Du Daozheng's whereabouts.
sentences.chinese: 出版商没有透露杜导正的下落。

sentences.english: They've done nothing at all to try and put the problem right.
sentences.chinese: 他们根本没做任何努力导正这个问题的事。

sentences.english: Revolution is sometimes necessary to correct social injustice.
sentences.chinese: 为了导正社会的不公平，革命有时是必要的。

definition: to adapt (to an environment etc)/to make sth suitable/adaptation/adjustment/adaptive
in order that/so that/so as to/to cause sth
(Tw) to draw on (others' experience)/to learn from (how others do things)/lesson to be learned (by observing others)
to return to the right path/to mend one's ways/to reform/Reformed (church etc)
variant of 意識形態|意识形态[yi4 shi2 xing2 tai4]
